page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This block is situated in North Lincolnshire and is mainly agricultural.The only concentrated area of population is the village of Holton le Moor.In addition to this are various homesteads scattered about the rest of the block. Geographically,it is partially situated on the edge of the Ancholme valley whilst the rest is part of the chalk escarpment known as the Lincolnshire Wolds. Historically,this area is interesting as part of it was used for mining,Romano-British pottery has been found,a brickyard once existed and the village of Holton le Moor is still part of an estate belonging to the Gibbons family.
